snippet: ARM, which has previously designed low-power semiconductors primarily for cellphones, is increasingly working in computer servers. A design announcement this week was aimed at the market for powerful cellphones, servers, networking equipment, even...
abstract: ARM, which has previously designed low-power semiconductors primarily for cellphones, is increasingly working in computer servers. A design announcement this week was aimed at the market for powerful cellphones, servers, networking equipment, even washing machines.

headline.main: When Cellphone Chips Rule Data Centers
